title: BBC Local Live: Northamptonshire on Thursday, 28 April 2016 - BBC News
summary: northampton borough council 's attempt to block the sale of a house belonging to christina cardoza has been adjourned .
a social worker in northamptonshire says senior management is `` out of tune '' with front-line staff when it comes to children in care .

documents.title: our live coverage through the day
text: local live is finished for today but we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with all the latest news , weather , sport and travel for northamptonshire .
if you missed anything , why not take a scroll through the page to catch up ?

documents.title: eu debate : ukip mep want british parliament to be 'supreme '
text: a northamptonshire ukip mep has said a vote to leave the eu would increase democracy in the uk .
if you want total democracy you do n't vote for the eu , so that the uk parliament is supreme . ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: instagram insists littergram app is renamed
text: instagram has ordered the owner of a british anti-litter app , developed in the county , to change its name .
littergram , owned by danny lucas from kent , and made by all things code based in northampton , invites people to share of rubbish and report the location to their council .
lawyers for the us photo-sharing giant , bought by facebook for $ 1bn ( £ 629m ) in 2012 , said the name was `` not acceptable '' .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: free breakfasts to help daventry students prepare for exams
text: students preparing for exams at a daventry school are being given a helping hand with a free breakfast scheme .
author: Daventry Express

documents.title: new film enterprise screen northants says it has 'big plans '
text: new film enterprise , screen northants , aims to both bring film makers to northamptonshire and make original community and feature films .
the social enterprise launched at its new shop in the grosvenor centre in northampton .
becky adams , who is behind the project , says they have `` big plans ''
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : pension putting tata buyers off new shop launched to encourage film in the county
text: here are your evening headlines :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: corby mp says ministers need to give update on tata steel 's uk sale
text: mp for corby tom pursglove has told the commons he wants ministers to come to parliament and explain `` exactly what is happening and [ what ] progress there is '' with the sale of tata steel uk 's business , including the plant in corby .

earlier , business minister sajid javid said there are `` commercial sensitivities '' preventing him from giving some information in public , but mr pursglove said despite this he and the `` steel community '' deserve an update .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: concerns over financial impact on groups who use wellingborough theatre
text: groups who fear they may be affected after the company running a town theatre went into administration have been told work is ongoing to secure the best resolution .
author: Northamptonshire Telegraph

documents.title: russian gp : lewis hamilton says he ca n't fall further behind nico rosberg
text: lewis hamilton says he must beat brackley-based mercedes team-mate nico rosberg at this weekend 's russian grand prix to kick-start his title defence .
rosberg has won the first three races of the season to build a commanding 36-point lead in the championship .
hamilton said : `` of course there is an urgency .
i ca n't really afford to fall any further back than that . ''
author: Andrew Benson
Chief F1 writer

documents.title: weather : rain arriving later
text: there has been rain , sleet but also sunny spells today .
here 's walgrave from bbc weather watcher 'delbuoy '
there will be more rain arriving later and further showers by tomorrow morning .
more details on the bbc weather website .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: is this northampton most business-savvy town ?
text: when you think of cutting-edge design , savvy start-ups and big money , silicon valley probably comes to mind - not the english countryside .
but bbc capital , which looks at finance and money across the world , has looked at the number of start-up businesses in northampton and found the town is doing rather well .
they investigated a number of high-tech and digital industries run largely by twenty-somethings , as well as looking into the more traditional shoe industry .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: works to begin to widen busy road in northampton and link it to new university campus
text: works will begin next week to widen a stretch of a busy road near northampton town centre as part of the town 's new university campus development .
author: Northants Herald & Post

documents.title: potential uk steel buyers baulk at pension liabilities , says javid
text: several potential buyers of tata steel 's british assets , including it 's plant in corby , have told the government they would not be willing to take on the company 's uk pension liabilities , business secretary sajid javid said .
`` a number of the potential buyers have said that we wo n't have much interest if we have to take over the current pension plan as it is , '' he said .
`` it 's a very big plan , it 's expensive compared to today 's plans and it 's not unreasonable for many buyers to say 'look we 're interested in the assets but this would be an issue ' . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: village school raises £ 10,000 for wheelchair for 10-year-old pupil
text: staff and students at mawsley primary school have raised over £ 10,000 to help a pupil with a rare disease .
tom dadd , 10. from old , has duchenne muscular dystrophy and needs a special electric wheelchair to get about .
in less than two months the community and school in mawsley raised the money needed , including from a teacher writing and releasing their own song .
author: Jordan Keller
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: cobblers loan : bid to stop house sale
text: cobblers loan : bid to stop house sale

documents.title: headlines : tata steel has no deadline for uk sale shop for those who want to be part of film industry
text: here are your afternoon headlines :
author: Sarah Foster
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: a vote for brexit is a vote for british parliament to be supreme - ukip mep
text: radio northampton has been in brussels debating the european union referendum today .
among the guests was ukip mep , margot parker , who said if you want the `` british parliament to be supreme so the mps you elect are there to vote in your laws '' then you should vote for brexit .
if you really want total democracy then you do n't vote for the eu . ''

documents.title: eu debate : are we 'better together ' or is northamptonshire 's voice 'lost '
text: after spending the day at the european parliament , andrew brown , a farmer from near corby , said the eu is a `` huge melting pot of culture '' that is `` better together '' .

debbie smith , a business owner from northampton , said she had been keen to see if anyone at the eu parliament could convince her to vote to remain - but , she added , that had not happened adding that northamptonshire 's `` representation is lost '' in the great eu machine .

documents.title: uk and the eu : better off out or in ?
text: northampton has been broadcasting live from brussels to debate the issues surrounding the june 23 referendum .
click here for a summary of the key arguments for and against british membership .

documents.title: eu debate : 'we can only tinker with laws ' , says tory euro-mp
text: emma mcclarkin ( right ) , the conservative mep for northamptonshire , has told bbc radio northampton that being an mep is a `` frustrating experience '' .
ms mcclarkin , who is backing the leave campaign , said meps can only `` tinker '' with laws which originate from the unelected european commission , adding the eu is `` beyond reform '' .

documents.title: eu debate : tory mep says it is time for a new relationship with the rest of the world
text: mep for northamptonshire , emma mcclarkin , has told bbc northampton she wants to leave the european union .
the conservative member said sometimes votes come at `` breakneck speed '' and there are `` so many amendments we do n't know what we are voting on '' .
i think it is time to have a new relationship .
and that relationship is with the rest of the world . ''

documents.title: eu debate : david cameron 's european union deal
text: those of us with long memories may remember that back at the start of the whole eu debate , prime minister david cameron came back to britain with a deal he claimed will give the country `` special status '' in the 28 nation bloc .
back in february , the bbc looked at the draft reform proposals drawn up by european council president donald tusk , the final text that was agreed and what mr cameron originally promised .

documents.title: eu debate : mep says immigrants 'contribute more than they take out '
text: labour mep glenis willmott , who backs the remain campaign was challenged on eu immigration , by debbie smith , a business owner from northampton , who said she was worried about the demand on health services and education .
dame willmott said `` migrant workers contribute more [ in taxes ] than they take out [ in benefits ] '' .
however , she felt was more could be done , including recruitment agencies not being able to just advertise abroad and `` closing loopholes that allow local staff to be undercut '' .

documents.title: equal pay and worker 's rights among benefits eu has brought - labour mep
text: labour mep glenis willmott ( left ) believes britain should remain in the european union , siting rules about mobile phone charges , worker 's rights and equal pay as benefits the eu has brought .
this is where many decisions are made that effect people 's everyday lives in northamptonshire . ''

documents.title: self-sufficiency , a level playing field - welcome to the eu farming debate
text: the ordinary person in the supermarket would like britain to be `` more self-sufficient '' when it comes to food , according to northampton business owner debbie smith - part of bbc northampton 's panel debating the eu referendum live in brussels today .

however , andrew brown , a farmer from near corby , says he and other farmers can only produce food `` if it makes money '' and that is `` why you have a common agricultural policy which gives us the level playing field '' across the eu .

documents.title: what is the eu and how does it work ?
text: northampton is in brussels today to discuss all things eu ahead of june 's referendum - but exactly what is the european union and how does it work ?
the bbc has produced a guide explaining the history of the eu and what it does - check it out here .

documents.title: referendum means public will be 'better informed on the eu , ' says mep
text: conservative mep for northamptonshire , andrew lewer , says regardless of which way people might vote in the referendum on eu membership on june 23 , one of the `` good things is that people will better informed '' on what the european union does .

mr lewer told bbc radio northampton , which is live in brussels today , the vote was n't the same as in 1975 's referendum and the public would be voting `` on the eu and all of it 's institutions '' .

documents.title: the uk 's eu referendum : all you need to know
text: northampton 's helen blaby is broadcasting live from the eu today to discuss the big issues around the june 23 referendum .
but what is the whole eu debate all about ?
the bbc 's brian wheeler and alex hunt produced this easy-to-understand guide which should help answer some of your questions .

documents.title: northampton listeners deliver impressions of european parliament
text: debbie smith , a business owner from northampton ( third from left ) , has told bbc northampton that during her time at the european parliament she has seen `` a lot of man-power , but do n't see a lot of results , '' adding there is `` no sense of urgency '' .
however , andrew brown ( right ) , a farmer from near corby said he now thinks the parliament `` actually is n't as big as you might think '' .
he said some of the more controversial things discussed in the parliament come from public suggestions , not from politicians or bureaucrats .

documents.title: eu debate : bbc radio northampton live from the european parliament
text: radio northampton 's lunch show is coming live from brussels ahead of the eu referendum on june 23 .
along with meeting meps and organisations based at the european parliament , two listeners have joined helen - northampton business owner , debbie smith , and andrew brown , a farmer from near corby
ready to go live from # brussels with @ twitterid @ twitterid

documents.title: nationalisation is 'rarely a solution , ' says business secretary
text: the business secretary sajid javid has told a committee of mps that although business minister anna soubry did not rule out nationalisation of tata 's steel 's uk business , `` rarely is nationalisation a solution - the best companies are in private hands '' .
corby mp tom pursglove has previously argued - even writing a letter to the prime minister - that nationalisation of the tata steel 's uk business should be considered .
however , mr javid said a `` successful outcome '' would be a `` commercial buyer '' .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: was the government mis-lead by tata over sale of uk steel business ?
text: business secretary sajid javid is currently answering questions from mps on the business and skills committee .
was he mislead by the company about its plans to sell its uk business , including its plant in corby ?
he says not .

the speed at which it was decided to sell the business appears to have taken him by surprise though : `` we did expect that there would be a board decision that would talk about the future of port talbot .
but what we did n't expect was that the news surrounding that decision would set out or talk about a timeline of a matter of weeks . ''
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: tata steel 'needs more government help ' to secure sale
text: tata steel uk 's chief executive has said the government needed to do more to help it find a buyer .
bimlendra jha told mps on the business select committee that a sale would not happen unless the pension fund deficit was addressed .
although there was no set deadline for a sale , tata could not continue to `` bleed '' indefinitely , he said .
the company is not prepared to split up its uk steel assets , which includes the plant in corby , to secure a sale .
author: BBC Business Live

documents.title: 'stakes are very high ' in tata sale
text: the crises surrounding tata steel , including at its corby plant , remains a major issue on the british political landscape .
bimlendra jha , chief executive of tata steel uk , told the business select committee the industry has not had enough support
`` stakes are very high . ''
@ twitterid as # tata boss tells mps govt support not enough # uksteel future # victorialive
@ twitterid @ twitterid
@ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid there is a glut globally hence nothing better can be done let the show run
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: case to block cardoza house sale adjourned
text: northampton borough council 's attempt to block the sale of a house belonging to christina cardoza , the wife of former northampton town chairman david cardoza has been adjourned at birmingham crown court until 20 may .
the authority said in a statement yesterday that it had made the request as part of continued efforts to recover the £ 10.25m loan it made to the club for the unfinished east stand .
it is understood the injunction against the house sale remains in place until the court hearing .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: top six finish now the goal for saints , says day
text: northampton saints forward christian day says finishing in the premiership top six and qualifying for the european champions cup is now the main aim following defeat a fortnight ago against leicester tigers .
day said if they beat bath at home this weekend `` and results go our way '' it could go a long way to securing qualification .
author: Graham McKechnie
BBC Radio Northampton sport

documents.title: eu debate : northamptonshire meps disagree over farming subsidies
text: northampton is live in brussels today , examining some of the issues around the european union in-out debate - including farming subsidies .

northamptonshire mep , conservative andrew lewer , who supports the campaign to leave the eu , said farmers will be supported by the treasury if britain leaves the eu and an `` important national debate '' would be need on subsidies .
however , labour mep , glenis willmott , said `` many farmers would go out of business '' if britain leaves the eu .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: management 'out of tune ' with staff , says social worker
text: a social worker in northamptonshire says senior management is `` out of tune '' with front-line staff when it comes to children in care .
around a fifth of posts in northamptonshire are currently vacant .
yesterday , northamptonshire county council 's children 's services were rated as `` requiring improvement , '' an improvement from its previous `` inadequate '' rating .
but janice snelson , who has been a social worker for eight years , says people at the top do n't understand the challenges they face .
author: Stuart Ratcliffe
BBC Look East

documents.title: frosty start across northamptonshire
text: despite it being almost may it was a very cold start to the day and the frost was captured in oundle by bbc weather watcher 'gingerwind '
you can send us your via email or sign up to be a bbc weather watcher .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: mistakes see northampton general hospital staff not paid for overtime
text: pay packets of some northampton general hospital staff were short by as much as £ 1,500 after a payroll error .
author: Northampton Chronicle & Echo

documents.title: radio northampton listeners head to brussels to look at eu parliament
text: the referendum to decide whether britain should leave or remain in the european union is being held on thursday , 23 june .
two bbc radio northampton listeners are heading to brussels as we look at how the eu impacts us in northamptonshire .
we 've been to meet them
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: heads to brussel to look at eu debate
text: this is eu parliament and it 's quite different from county hall

throughout the day we 'll be in brussels seeing how this place impacts northamptonshire and hearing from politicians , organisations , and two bbc radio northampton listeners on both sides of the eu debate ahead of the referendum on june 23 .
author: Sam Read
BBC Radio Northampton politics reporter

documents.title: court to decide if borough council can block cardoza house sale
text: a judge is due to decide this morning whether a house belonging to the wife of the former northampton town chairman david cardoza should be sold .
northampton borough council is trying to get an interim injunction to prevent the sale .

the authority says the court hearing in birmingham is part of its efforts to recover the £ 10.25m loan it made to football club , which was intended to fund a new stand at sixfields but was never built .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : fine start , cloudier and wetter later
text: after a fine start to the day , it will turn increasingly cloudy through the afternoon with rain arriving later on .
top temperature 10c ( 50f ) .
you can see my full forecast below
author: Elizabeth Rizzini
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: two lanes closed on m1 and problems on the a45 at great billing way
text: the m1 has two lanes blocked southbound between junction 15 ( northampton ) and junction 14 ( milton keynes ) because of an accident involving two cars .
elsewhere , on the a45 westbound there are long delays because one lane is blocked at the great billing way junction due to an accident between three cars .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : meps make case on eu question decision to be made on cardoza 's house
text: here are the top stories this morning
author: Andrew Radd
BBC Radio Northampton

documents.title: good morning and welcome to local live for northamptonshire
text: good morning .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , sport and travel for the county between now and 18:00 .
if you want to get in touch then please email me , tweet us , or head to facebook .
author: Pete Cooper
BBC Local Live
